chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Caleb A Goetzen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 162 days credit if revoked from probation.

records.addlTxt:
3:18 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen in court, in custody.  Attorney David R. Knaapen in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Caleb A Goetzen. 
Both parties have reviewed the PSI and the letter from Mr. Zipper. Attorney Sheets has two corrections to make in the PSI. Attorney Knaapen has nothing he would like to correct. Court accepts those changes. Attorney Knaapen gives the court his sentencing recommendation. Attorney Sheets makes his sentencing recommendation. Defendant makes a statement to the court regarding sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on July 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney David R. Knaapen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Caleb A Goetzen in court, in custody.  Attorney Eric Sheets in court for Caleb A Goetzen.
Plea hearing on May 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No contact with SJS, except through telephone and letters. No contact with victim or their residences. - DMS. $10,000
No contact w/ SJS, except through telephone and letters. No contact w/victim or their residence - DMS.

1:01 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen appeared by video, in custody in the Wood County Jail, Attorney Eric Sheets for Caleb A Goetzen appeared by phone, Attorney David R. Knaapen for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. Victim SJS appears in court by telephone.
Court addresses the bond motion to modify the no contact condition to allow contact with SJS.
Court grants and modifies the bond to No contact with SJS, except through telephone and letters. No contact w/ victim or residence - DMS.
Bail/bond hearing on March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

2:08 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Eric Sheets for Caleb A Goetzen appeared in court, Attorney David R. Knaapen for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Attorney Sheets informs the court the victim would like to have contact and gives a recommendation for a bond modification. Attorney Knaapen wants the victim here to make a statement to the court before bond is modified. 
Bond is continued.

2:01 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Eric Sheets for Caleb A Goetzen appeared in court, Attorney David R. Knaapen for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
Defendant waives the preliminary hearing. Not guilty pleas are entered.
Final pre-trial scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond Condition
Granted. Attorney Sheets Appointed. No reimbursement
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on March 16, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:16 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen in court, in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caleb A Goetzen appeared by video means.
Court gives the defendant an appointment of counsel form to fill out to get Attorney Sheets on this case as well. Defendants requests to waive time limits and get a new date. Court grants and this matter will be reset.
Bond is continued.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on February 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:22 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen in court, in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Caleb A Goetzen appeared by video means.
Court finds probable cause to continue this matter. This matter will be bound over for preliminary hearing and arraignment. Bond is continued.
Defendant requests modification of the no contact condition of his bond. Court denies modification today.
No contact with SS and or DMS or their residences. MDPD 22-1598 $10,000

1:30 PM Defendant Caleb A Goetzen appears in court, in custody. Attorney Emily Nolan-Plutchak appears in court. Attorney Matthew McElroy appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears by video means. Court finds probable cause to continue this matter.
No contact w/victim or their residence - SJS and DMS
